snippet: A judge in Detroit’s bankruptcy case ruled that public pensions are not protected from cuts, potentially altering the course of bankruptcies in cities like Stockton and San Bernardino, Calif.
abstract: News analysis; ruling by Judge Steven W Rhodes that Detroit's public pensions are not protected from cuts could alter the course of other bankrupt cities, which had been operating under the assumption that pensions were untouchable.
lead_paragraph: A judge in Detroit’s bankruptcy case ruled that public pensions are not protected from cuts, potentially altering the course of bankruptcies in cities like Stockton and San Bernardino, Calif.

headline.main: Pension Ruling in Detroit Echoes West to California
headline.print_headline: Pension Ruling in Detroit Echoes West to California
